wikipedia_page.main: Philip William Bryce Lever, 3rd Viscount Leverhulme  (1 July 1915 – 4 July 2000) was a British peer and racehorse owner.

** Philip Lever, 3rd Viscount Leverhulme, British peer (d. 2000)

link_mentions.page: List of knights and ladies of the Garter

response: In 1982, the Leverhulme Pavilion at Oldfield was opened by Philip Lever, 3rd Viscount Leverhulme, Lord Leverhulme's grandson. Other additions to the school's facilities include the sports complex and swimming pool in 1986; the Arts & Conference Centre, opened by Diana, Princess of Wales in 1993; and Patterdale Hall, an outdoor pursuits centre at the southern end of Ullswater in the Lake District.

response: *Philip Lever, 3rd Viscount Leverhulme (1915–2000), British landowner and race-horse owner
